abstract: In the right place and in the right hands, a flash of humor can be a powerful tool in our writing. Understatement is effective, and we're not looking for belly laughs. It's important for editors to serve as a skeptical audience, lest a writer's wit seem witty mostly to the writer. But here are a few recent examples where an amusing incongruity made a sharp point. And if readers smiled, so much the better.
